intro: Paederia lanuginosa, commonly known as the silky paederia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its hairy, creeping stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically ovate or elliptical with a slightly hairy surface. Paederia lanuginosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
